awd_titl_txt: U.S.-France Cooperative Research:  Molecular Mechanism of   Homologous Pairing and DNA Strand Exchange
awd_abstract_narration: This three-year award for U.S.-France cooperative research on genetic recombination   involves Stephen Kowalczykowski of the University of California at Davis, Alain Nicolas,   Marie Dutreix, and Francis Fabre of the Institut Curie in Paris, France.  The award   provides travel support and living expenses to Dr. Kowalczykowski and a graduate   student.  The objective of their research is to investigate homologous pairing and   subsequent exchange of DNA strands.  This process is mediated by a unique class of   proteins represented by the prototypic RecA protein from Escherichia coli and by the new   Rad51 protein from Saccharomyces cerevisiae.  The U.S. investigator brings to this   collaboration expertise in the physical and biochemical aspects of recombination.  This is   complemented by French expertise in molecular genetics.  The project will advance   fundamental understanding of the biological processes involved in genetic recombination,   including aberrant processes that lead to deleterious genomic rearrangements.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
